definition: to leak/to expose (sb's secret)/to spill the beans/to let the cat out of the bag
dew/syrup/nectar/outdoors (not under cover)/to show/to reveal/to betray/to expose
surname Lu
to show/to reveal/to betray/to expose
stuffing/forcemeat/filling
erhua variant of 露餡|露馅[lou4 xian4]

sentences.english: Her veneer of politeness began to crack.
sentences.chinese: 她那彬彬有禮的僞裝開始露餡兒了。

sentences.english: Just make sure to hide the wires, lest mess up the illusion.
sentences.chinese: 不過一定要把導線藏好，否則就露餡了。

sentences.english: As long as they are good fakes, other people won't know any different.
sentences.chinese: 只要假貨不露餡，別人也就看不出差別。

sentences.english: But they betray themselves every_time they open their mouths.
sentences.chinese: 但他們每次開口說話就會露餡。

sentences.english: What betrayed the peddler who claimed to sell real diamonds?
sentences.chinese: 聲稱賣真鑽石的小販是怎樣露餡的？

sentences.english: Their cloak of neutrality in the Iran-Iraq war was beginning to wear a bit thin.
sentences.chinese: 戰爭中表面上所採取的中立態度開始有點露餡了。

sentences.english: His words however rang untrue as he discussed his activities both in and outside of the prison.
sentences.chinese: 但談起在監獄內外的活動時，他露餡了。

definition: see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
half a life/only half alive/barely alive/(scared, beaten etc) half to death
keenly felt pain/bitter anguish
lit. to swell one's face up by slapping it to look imposing (idiom); to seek to impress by feigning more than one's abilities
pinyin: da3 zhong3 lian3 chong1 pang4 zi5

definition: Please do as you wish!/You are welcome to do whatever you like!/Please make yourself at home.
lit. 300 silver taels not hidden here (idiom); fig. to reveal what one intends to hide
pinyin: ci3 di4 wu2 yin2 san1 bai3 liang3

definition: (not) a single person/(no) one

(TV or movie) blooper/continuity error/(theater) to flub one's lines/unintended exposure of a body part/to be exposed (of a scheme or trick)/to reveal sth one intended to conceal through a slip of the tongue/to blow one's cover
to drown sb in a wicker basket, a form of 沉潭[chen2 tan2]
female gossip/busybody
lit. firing after the horse/fig. belated action/giving advice in hindsight
trivial matter/a piece of cake
foolish talk/nonsense
to boast
to censor an image/to pixelate
A rabbit doesn't eat the grass by its own burrow (idiom); One shouldn't do anything to harm one's neighbors.
pinyin: tu4 zi5 bu4 chi1 wo1 bian1 cao3
